TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MessageReceiver extends Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.ClientEntity implements class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Core.IMessageReceiver, class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Core.IReceiverClient, class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.IClientEntity
Public Class MessageReceiver Inherits ClientEntity Implements IMessageReceiver

Docs.summary: The MessageReceiver can be used to receive messages from Queues and Subscriptions and acknowledge them.
Docs.remarks: The MessageReceiver provides advanced functionality that is not found in the or . For instance, , which allows you to receive messages on demand, but also requires you to manually renew locks using . It uses AMQP protocol to communicate with service.

Docs.param: The lock token of the .
The properties of the message to modify while deferring the message.
Docs.summary: Indicates that the receiver wants to defer the processing for the message.
Docs.remarks: A lock token can be found in , only when is set to . In order to receive this message again in the future, you will need to save the and receive it using . Deferring messages does not impact message's expiration, meaning that deferred messages can still expire. This operation can only be performed on messages that were received by this receiver.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message> PeekAsync ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message> PeekAsync() cil managed
Public Function PeekAsync () As Task(Of Message)

Docs.summary: Fetches the next active message without changing the state of the receiver or the message source.
Docs.returns: The that represents the next message to be read. Returns null when nothing to peek.
Docs.remarks: The first call to fetches the first active message for this receiver. Each subsequent call fetches the subsequent message in the entity. Unlike a received message, peeked message will not have lock token associated with it, and hence it cannot be Completed/Abandoned/Deferred/Deadlettered/Renewed. Also, unlike , this method will fetch even Deferred messages (but not Deadlettered message)

MemberSignature.Value: public int PrefetchCount { get; set; }
.property instance int32 PrefetchCount
Public Property PrefetchCount As Integer

Docs.summary: Prefetch speeds up the message flow by aiming to have a message readily available for local retrieval when and before the application asks for one using Receive. Setting a non-zero value prefetches PrefetchCount number of messages. Setting the value to zero turns prefetch off. Defaults to 0.
Docs.value: The number of messages that the message receiver can simultaneously request.

remarks.para: When Prefetch is enabled, the receiver will quietly acquire more messages, up to the PrefetchCount limit, than what the application immediately asks for. A single initial Receive/ReceiveAsync call will therefore acquire a message for immediate consumption that will be returned as soon as available, and the client will proceed to acquire further messages to fill the prefetch buffer in the background.

While messages are available in the prefetch buffer, any subsequent ReceiveAsync calls will be immediately satisfied from the buffer, and the buffer is replenished in the background as space becomes available.If there are no messages available for delivery, the receive operation will drain the buffer and then wait or block as expected.
Prefetch also works equivalently with the APIs.
Updates to this value take effect on the next receive call to the service.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Threading.Tasks.Task RenewLockAsync (Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message message);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task RenewLockAsync(class Microsoft.Azure.ServiceBus.Message message) cil managed

Docs.param: To be added.
Docs.summary: Renews the lock on the message specified by the lock token. The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the queue.
Docs.remarks: When a message is received in mode, the message is locked on the server for this receiver instance for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation (LockDuration). If processing of the message requires longer than this duration, the lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the message is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.

Docs.param: Lock token associated with the message.
Docs.summary: Renews the lock on the message. The lock will be renewed based on the setting specified on the queue. New lock token expiry date and time in UTC format.
Docs.remarks: When a message is received in mode, the message is locked on the server for this receiver instance for a duration as specified during the Queue/Subscription creation (LockDuration). If processing of the message requires longer than this duration, the lock needs to be renewed. For each renewal, it resets the time the message is locked by the LockDuration set on the Entity.
